detaileddescription.para: The ANSI library contains various terminal related functions, for example enabling or disabling the cursor, clearing lines, and interactive input.
The following publically doucmented procedures and functions are available via this library.

sect3.title: PROChideCursor
sect3.para: hide text cursor

sect3.title: PROCshowCursor
sect3.para: show text cursor

sect3.title: PROCclearLineFromCursor
sect3.para: Clear the text on the current line from the cursor to the right

sect3.title: PROCEDabort
sect3.para: Emulate pressing ESC while waiting on interactive input

sect3.title: FNEdResult$()
sect3.para: Get the line editor result text. In the event of an aborted line (ESC pressed) this returns an empty string and FNEdAborted() returns TRUE.

sect3.title: FNEdAborted()
sect3.para: Return TRUE if line edit was aborted (ESC pressed)

sect3.title: PROCEdLine
sect3.para: Accept line input using line-edit and history. On completion of the procedure, you can obtain the completed line line in FNEdResult$(). In the event the user pressed ESC, FNEdAborted() will return TRUE

sect3.title: PROCEDup
sect3.para: Emulate pressing cursor UP in the interactive editor. This will navigate through history, if enabled.

sect3.title: PROCEDdown
sect3.para: Emulate pressing cursor DOWN in the interactive editor. This will navigate through history, if enabled.

sect3.title: PROCEdAddHistory(hist$)
sect3.para: Add a line to the interactive edit history, if interactive history was enabled when calling PROCEdInit(). There is no practical limit on the size of the history, as it will be expanded to accomodate any additional lines added in allocations of 50 possible entries.

sect3.title: PROCEDleft
sect3.para: Emulate pressing cursor LEFT in the interactive editor. The cursor will be moved one character left unless it is at the start of the input.

sect3.title: PROCEDright
sect3.para: Emulate pressing cursor RIGHT in the interactive editor. The cursor will be moved one character right unless it is at the end of the input.

sect3.title: PROCEDend
sect3.para: Emulate pressing END in the interactive editor. The cursor will be moved to the end of the input text.

sect3.title: PROCEDhome
sect3.para: Emulate pressing HOME in the interactive editor. The cursor will be moved to the start of the input text.
REM handle delete edit key

sect3.title: PROCEDdelete
sect3.para: Emulate pressing delete in the interactive editor. The character to the right, if any, will be deleted.

sect3.title: PROCEDbackSpace
sect3.para: Emulate pressing backspace in the interactive editor. The character to the left, if any, will be deleted and the cursor advanced one character left.

sect3.title: PROCEDinsertChar(i)
sect3.para: Emulate inserting an ASCII character whos code is represented by i into the interactive editor. If there is space in the current line, the character will be inserted at the cursor position.

sect3.title: PROCEdRun
sect3.para: Check the input for new keys and insert them into the edit history. This should be called at regular intervals and no other facility should call INPUT or INKEY$ during this time.

sect3.title: PROCEdInit(history)
sect3.para:
initialise interactive line editor. You should call this once, before you call any other interactive line editor procedures or functions.
history parameter value
Meaning
TRUE
Enable and allow use of edit history. Use PROCEdAddEditHistory() to add lines to the history.
FALSE
Disable and disallow use of edit history. PROCEdAddEditHistory() and cursor UP and DOWN keys will be ignored.

sect3.title: PROCEdStart
sect3.para: Start interactive line input. This is used when you wish to handle the input loop yourself. Line editing begins at the current cursor position and will continue until the end of the current line. For example:
